science: Octopuses have three hearts.
Bananas are radioactive.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time under the right conditions.
There are more possible games of chess than atoms in the observable universe.
Humans share about 60 percent of their DNA with bananas.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Light from the Sun takes about 8 minutes to reach Earth.
Your brain uses about 20 percent of your body's energy.
There are more neurons in your brain than stars in the Milky Way.
Honey never spoils.
Sharks existed before trees.
Sound travels faster in water than in air.
Glass is not a supercooled liquid; it is a solid.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
There are taste receptors in your lungs.
Humans glow faintly due to bioluminescence.
The human body contains enough carbon to make about 900 pencils.
Hot water can freeze faster than cold water.
Butterflies can remember being caterpillars.
Atoms are mostly empty space.
history: Cleopatra lived closer to the Moon landing than to the construction of the pyramids.
Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
Napoleon was once attacked by rabbits.
Ancient Romans used urine as detergent.
Vikings used cats to protect grain stores.
The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes.
Julius Caesar was once kidnapped by pirates.
The Eiffel Tower was meant to be temporary.
Samurai existed at the same time as cowboys.
Ancient Egyptians used toothpaste.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
Ketchup was once sold as medicine.
Medieval knights sometimes fought snails in art.
George Washington grew marijuana.
The first alarm clock could only ring at one time.
Ancient Greeks had vending machines.
The Colosseum was once flooded for mock naval battles.
Pineapples were once symbols of extreme wealth.
Roman emperors kept eels as pets.
The printing press caused mass panic.
weird: There is a town that banned death.
Some turtles can breathe through their butts.
Scotland has 421 words for snow.
You can smell rain before it falls.
There are stairs that go nowhere in some castles.
A cloud can weigh over a million tons.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins.
Antarctica has blood-red waterfalls.
There are lakes that can turn animals into stone.
Cows have best friends.
There are more fake flamingos than real ones.
A shrimp can punch faster than a bullet.
Butter can explode under the right conditions.
Some metals explode in water.
There is a species of jellyfish that is biologically immortal.
Humans can hear plants when stressed.
Trees can communicate with each other.
Some frogs can freeze solid and survive.
There are invisible animals living on your face.
The Moon has moonquakes.
movies: The sound of lightsabers was made using old TV interference.
The Jurassic Park T-Rex roar is a mix of animal sounds.
The Matrix code is actually sushi recipes.
Lord of the Rings used real chainmail armor.
Psycho was the first movie to show a toilet flushing.
In Alien, the actors did not know about the chestburster scene.
Toy Story was the first fully computer-animated movie.
The Godfather cat was a stray found on set.
The snow in The Wizard of Oz was asbestos.
Back to the Future originally used a refrigerator as the time machine.
Indiana Jones used a real gun because Harrison Ford was sick.
The Wilhelm scream appears in hundreds of movies.
Titanic’s water was freezing cold during filming.
The Dark Knight hospital explosion was real.
Jaws barely worked, forcing less screen time.
Mad Max used real car crashes.
Inception used real rotating hallways.
Rocky’s script was written in three days.
The Blair Witch actors were actually lost.
Home Alone’s tarantula crawl was real.
games: Pac-Man was inspired by a slice of pizza.
Mario was originally a carpenter.
The PlayStation was almost a Nintendo console.
Tetris was created in the Soviet Union.
Minecraft was made in Java.
The Xbox was nearly named DirectX Box.
The first Easter egg appeared in Adventure on Atari.
Pokémon was inspired by insect collecting.
DOOM runs on almost anything.
World of Warcraft has hosted virtual funerals.
Sonic was designed to rival Mario.
The Konami Code was added to make testing easier.
GTA maps are based on real cities.
Nintendo started as a playing card company.
The Sims has no spoken language.
Zelda was inspired by childhood exploration.
Halo was originally a strategy game.
Pac-Man ghosts each have unique behavior.
Skyrim has been released many times.
Speedrunning created new game communities.
boring: Most people blink about 15 times per minute.
The alphabet has 26 letters in English.
The Sun rises in the east.
music: Music can reduce stress levels.
The Beatles never learned to read music.
Mozart wrote his first symphony at age eight.
The longest song is over 13 hours long.
Vinyl records are making a comeback.
Drums are one of the oldest instruments.
Heavy metal originated in the late 1960s.
The piano has 88 keys.
Listening to music releases dopamine.
Beethoven continued composing while deaf.
The guitar is over 4,000 years old.
Singing can boost immune function.
Hip hop began in the Bronx.
Music can improve memory.
The first music video aired on MTV in 1981.
Some songs get stuck due to repetition.
Music tempo can affect heart rate.
The human voice is an instrument.
Concerts existed in ancient Greece.
Silence is part of music.
geography: Russia is the largest country by area.

Australia is wider than the Moon.

Greenland is mostly ice-covered.
The Dead Sea is below sea level.
There are five oceans on Earth.
France has borders with eight countries.

Vatican City is the smallest country.
Nepal has eight of the ten tallest mountains.
Alaska has the most coastline in the US.
Brazil contains most of the Amazon rainforest.
funny: Some cats are allergic to humans.
You cannot hum while holding your nose.
Your stomach thinks all potatoes are mashed.

Sloths sometimes mistake their arms for branches.
